report_title: Industry Report on Miniature Golf Courses
executive_summary: Over the past five years, the industry has faced various setbacks from the recession and competition from alternate entertainment options. Specifically, the miniature golf courses contended with dwindling demand due to COVID-19 as public gatherings were restricted. But demand has picked up as the pandemic subsides. As a result, industry revenue has improved at a CAGR of 3.5% to $441.6 million over the five years to 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Miniature golf has been a popular nationwide pastime since its adoption in the United States in the early 20th century. But rising competition from alternate forms of entertainment has resulted in declining demand. Digital and in-home entertainment options are also increasingly replacing location-based entertainment offerings like miniature golf.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Adverse Effects of COVID-19 Pandemic Weighed on the Industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The industry has been hit by COVID-19, which reduced industry demand significantly. As a result of various shelter-in-place orders and social distancing protocols, customers refrained from visiting industry establishments. To the industry's benefit, the rollout of vaccines led to easing COVID-19 restrictions, enabling industry establishments to fully reopen.

Miniature golf courses require a high degree of maintenance, resulting in higher wage costs, one of the primary factors that has limited industry profit. Due to escalating competition and regulatory requirements, industry operators have increasingly exited the industry.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A GROWING FRANCHISEE PRESENCE SUPPORTS REVENUE GROWTH
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry is highly fragmented; for example, over 98.0% of companies have just one location and employ fewer than 10 full-time people on average. The industry is expected to remain highly fragmented during the outlook period. So franchise operators will likely become more prevalent because they benefit from greater brand exposure and marketing.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: INDUSTRY REVENUE DEPENDS ON ECONOMIC GROWTH
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The economy is expected to gradually return to prerecession growth, with positive job growth leading to accelerated income gains, positively affecting miniature golf courses. Per capita disposable income is forecast to rise during the outlook period, enabling consumers to ramp up purchases of discretionary entertainment options, such as miniature golf.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry operate miniature golfing courses which generally feature a series of short constructed obstacle courses. Industry operators may also offer arcade games, food and beverage items and amusement park rides.
key_trends: Miniature golf courses experienced lowered demand during COVID-19. Fortunately, removing COVID-19 restrictions has enabled industry revenue to rebound significantly.
The industry will continue to experience competition from other forms of entertainment and sports. Many miniature golf course operators will expand inorganically by increasing franchise operations.
Companies that operate mini golf courses must abide by environmental regulations. Miniature golf courses are responsible for a significant amount of land.
A successful course should be established in an area with land available for a good price. A temperate climate allows playing year-round.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Adults between 25-44 frequent miniature golf to spend time with friends and family. Most are employed with income to spend.
Adults in this age group typically have children/grandchildren, supporting demand to visit miniature golf courses. Established careers allow generous spending.
Baby boomers in this group may have difficulties with physical activities. Despite retirement funds, limited income reduces demand.
Individuals in this age group have restricted income to spend on miniature golf. More entertainment options lower demand.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Customers can opt for other outdoor activities or seek in-home entertainment instead of miniature golf.
Miniature golf courses require a high degree of customer service, so access to labor is critical.
Miniature golf courses cater primarily to regional or local customers due to limitations in expanding nationally.
Profit varies significantly based on location, scale of operations, and local competition.
Wages are the largest expense for miniature golf courses due to customer service and maintenance needs.

regulations_points.regulation_description: A high profile location offering easy access and parking will likely drive consumer demand.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Carrying out all necessary maintenance to keep facilities in good condition
regulations_points.regulation_description: Regular facility maintenance and upkeep is required to ensure customer safety and to help extend the life span of equipment, which will likely help reduce operating costs and increase profit.
Due to the copious entertainment options available to consumers, industry operators must have skills in operating a business profitably.

basis_points.basis_description: The industry is highly fragmented with no single company accounting for more than 5.0% of market share.
Besides regulatory requirements, the capital requirement hinders new entrants from entering the industry.
Industry services are highly substitutable. Customers can opt for other outdoor activities or seek in-home entertainment.
Miniature golf courses must have access to an abundant labor supply because their core offerings require a high degree of customer service.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages are the industry's largest expense
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Miniature golf courses require employees for customer-service functions, overseeing and helping customers and maintenance work. Miniature golf courses have increased the use of technology such as online reservation and POS systems to reduce their reliance on labor. They also take advantage of hiring of part-time and seasonal employees.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Depreciation is a significant expense for miniature golf courses
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Generally, the minimum capital investment requirement for commencing operations is $150,000. Industry operators must invest in building and maintaining water features, such as ponds and rivers, including purchasing commercial-grade pumps. Companies must also invest in lighting systems, artificial rocks for landscaping, theme structures, and scenes. Depending on the services offered, miniature golf courses may also invest in arcade game equipment, change machines and debit and game card payment systems.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry. This creates an environment where the threat of new technologies driving disruption is low.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Industry performance depends on customers' leisure time and discretionary spending. Customers visit miniature golf courses when they have ample leisure and income. The relationship between leisure and income can sometimes be conversely related. When people earn higher incomes because they work more, they will have less leisure time to spend on miniature golf courses.
